questions.question: Which major city was nearest to the epicentre of the magnitude‑6.0 earthquake that struck eastern Afghanistan on 31 August 2025?
questions.explanation: Reports state the quake's epicentre was near Jalalabad on the Nangarhar–Kunar provincial border; Jalalabad is the nearest major city to that area. (Magnitude and location reported in news coverage and USGS-derived reports.)

questions.question: Camp Sovereignty — the First Nations protest camp that was stormed after the Aug. 31 "March for Australia" rallies — is located in which Melbourne park?
questions.explanation: Reporting identifies Camp Sovereignty as the Indigenous protest encampment at King’s Domain (sometimes styled “Kings Domain”) in Melbourne, which was stormed after the Aug. 31, 2025 "March for Australia" rallies.

questions.question: On the night of Monday 1 September 2025, where did emergency services respond to a collision between a car and a truck that was linked to a suspected shooting?

answers.text: Monash Freeway and Princes Highway, Dandenong
Hume Freeway exit/entry ramp and Cooper Street, Epping

questions.explanation: Victoria Police and media reports state the incident occurred at the Hume Freeway exit/entry ramp and Cooper Street in Epping (northern Melbourne) at about 9:30pm on Monday 1 September 2025.

questions.question: How many wickets did Mitchell Starc finish with in his T20 International career, according to his Sept. 2, 2025 retirement announcement?
questions.explanation: Mitchell Starc announced his retirement from T20 internationals on Sept. 2, 2025, finishing his T20I career with 79 wickets in 65 matches, as reported in contemporary coverage.

questions.question: For which film did Canadian actor Graham Greene receive an Academy Award nomination?
questions.explanation: Graham Greene was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his role as Kicking Bird in Dances with Wolves (1990).
